intro: Pennellia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited pennellia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has small, compound leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that matures in late summer, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
